availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. H. Harrison (Lexington, Kentucky, deputy sheriff)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, deputy sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy Harrison. Father of M. J. Harrison, Nannie R. Harrison, William Harrison, James Harrison, and Ida Harrison. Deputy sheriff of Fayette County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette county, 4th ward, City of Lexington 1, p. 85. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette county, 4th ward, City of Lexington, p. 51.
